title: Enhancing Analytical Competency for Educational Suitability of Mathematics Textbook Instruction

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding middle school mathematics basic concepts (ratios, proportional relationships, etc.), foundational pedagogical knowledge
context.additional_context: Program for pre-service secondary mathematics teachers to develop the ability to analyze the pedagogical suitability of mathematics textbooks. Conducted through formative assessment-centered self-directed learning using digital tools.

learning_goals: Apply a systematic framework to analyze pedagogical suitability in mathematics textbook lesson design

Learners will select 3 key concepts—‘Adequacy of Medical Intervention,’ ‘Respect for Patient Autonomy,’ and ‘Distribution of Social Resources’—from the ‘Proportionality’ chapter in a medical ethics textbook, and write a 500±50-character critical evaluation report analyzing the alignment of learning objectives-activities-assessments for each concept. The report must achieve ≥B+ grade (≥3/4 points) in ≥2 of 3 rubric criteria: clarity (structured logic flow), logicality (causal relationships between concepts), and evidence (textbook/case citations).

Learners diagnose three limitations of the currently used textbook materials based on formative assessment results (item-wise accuracy rates, incorrect answer type analysis) and propose at least two specific improvement strategies for each limitation (e.g., additional case presentations, enhanced terminology explanations, strengthened visual materials), ensuring validity with a peer evaluation average of 4.0 or higher on a 5-point scale.

resources: Digital educational content creation tools (Canva, Miricanvas, etc.)
Online collaboration platforms for feedback (Padlet, Google Docs, etc.)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
